column2: This character does not hail from the Mushroom World.

This is an Ameboid. Originally existing in an alternate dimension, Ameboids are comprised of gel and possess no internal organs. Capable of near-instant division by mitosis, they can create up to five copies of themselves at once.
This is a Sea Anemone. Sea Anemones are native to underwater biomes and, to rule or function on land, must be in an aquatic enclosure.
This is an Angry Sun. Despite its name, it is not any sort of star. Rather, it is a flying being of living fire and energy, consumed with rage at all life besides itself.

This is a jumped up animal that somehow managed to gain or possess sapience. These creatures almost always have extradimensional counterparts in the so-called "Earth", where men are thought to have come from eons ago.
This is an Ankiron: a fiercely armed tortoise featuring massive artillery arrays on its shell.
This is an Anuboo: a mysterious dog-like spirit native to the Teehee Valley of the Beanbean Kingdom.

This is an Appleby. Applebies are creatures that live underground, only surfacing to plant and harvest fruit or defend themselves. As their name suggests, apples are their primary source of food, and they will surface to plant their own apple orchards, that they may acquire more apples.
This is an Attacky Sack. Attacky Sacks are beautifully colored, flying, intelligent, spherical carnivores with a fierce appetite.
This creature is some form of balloon or other latex-coated being that is capable of flight.

This is a Bandinero, native to the Shake Dimension as well as the Mushroom World. Although Bandineroes are a type of Goom, they cannot produce fertile offspring with other Gooms and are thus considered a wholly separate species.

This is a scheming Bandit. Distinguished by their height and lack of a mask, Bandits are a type of Shy Guy possessing fantastic speed and, as their name implies, a tendancy to engage in all forms of theft. Hiearchies of Bandits are very common: Bandits possessing far higher criminal skills will wear different colors than the standard blue or red, which normally indicate pickpockets. The traditional leader of a pack or family of Bandits is a Big Bandit, which has the exclusive privilege of donning green robes. However, Bandit underlings are not afraid to abandon Big Bandits that show weakness. Bandits are generally not to be trusted.
This is a Barney Bubble. Barney Bubbles are slow moving, long-lived beings that shoot weaponized bubbles.
This is a Beaker. Beakers are quiet, pacifistic, spinning beings native to the Peaceful Woods, and once enslaved by Wario during his attempted conquest of what he deemed the "Wario Woods".

A bear is a huge, short-tailed mammals with large skulls and immensely powerful jaws. As mammals, bears join men, Ukikis, moles, Mousers, Kongs, and others in a small, elite cadre of warm-blooded, extremely intelligent creatures. In taxonomy, they are referred to as "Ursa", "Ursidae", or "Ursids", the first of which is an extremely common name amongst the species. There are only two locations in the Mushroom World known to host bears: the mechanical structures of the Mario Zone and the Northern Kremisphere. Mario Zone Bears are smaller than Toads and ride beach balls, while the collosal Kremisphere Bears tower over even Donkey Kong.

This is a Beanie, the most common creature in the Beanbean Kingdom. Beanies are similar in appearence and abilities to Goombas, but strongly resemble legumes or pears instead of fungi. Indeed, where Goombas are fungal-based, Beanies are considered a plant-based being and, when no food is available, can harness photosynthesis to sustain themselves. Like Goombas, many Beanies can survive being stepped on and will exhibit identical issues with being stepped on as Goombas. Similarly to Goombas, Baenies, at some point, rebelled against the proper Beanbean Kingdom, but unlike Goombas, the Beanies were successfully subdued back under the Beanbean Crown. Now, roving Beanie bandits and raiders accost the countryside to attack travellers while more "civilized" Beanies govern as vassals and independent fiefdoms in the Beanish realm. Unlike Goombas, Beanies' tribal and familial structure have long been crushed and replaced with the modern ways of the greater Beanbean Kingdom.
This is a Beanish, a charasmatic humanoid and dominant species of the Beanbean Kingdom.
This is a bee. Bees are eusocial, collecting in hives and nests under a hiearchy of dependent drones and a queen. Bees, notably, always form a matriarchial society.
This is a Belome. Belomes are ancient, powerful canids found at the Land's End.

I just hope no one finds out who fed this GREAT, BIG, BERTHA Cheep Cheep some rocks, though. It's true what they say about the GREAT, BIG, BERTHA. I can spit rocks farther with the GREAT, BIG, BERTHA'S help than with any of the normal Cheep Cheeps. That rock just goes and goes. One rock flew through a Yoshi chief's mansion window. I wish it had hit that Birdo. Stupid Birdo. I hate that Birdo.
This is some form of bivalve, be it is a clam, oyster, mussel, scallop, or other such creature.
This is a Blockhopper. Blockoppers are durable, jumping machines affixed inside brick blocks.
This is a Blockstepper. Blocksteppers are social block-shaped beings that almost always travel in groups.
This is a Blooper: an extremely intelligent, fast moving, floating jellyfish. They can breathe on land and on water and are capable of flight and extremely fast swimming.
This is a Blowhard. Blowhards are sapient, mechanical fans that normally nest in one location and rarely move. It is unknown who created them or for what purpose
This is a Blurker. Blurkers are puffy, squishy blocks that are immune to being stomped on.

This is a Blurp, also known as a Blurpfish. While very similar and closely related to Cheep Cheeps, they are not able to produce fertile offspring with Cheep Cheeps, and thus, are considered their own species.

This is a Bob-omb: a highly intelligent, sapient, powerful explosive device capable of detonating itself and operating artillery. Some Bob-ombs are capable of detonating themselves on a regular basis, while others are suicide bombers. Bob-ombs have their own endemic language that sound like variations of "Vick" in rapid succession, but are universally capable of speaking the common language of the Mushroom World.

This is a Bombat. Bombats were engineered five thousand years ago to protect the ancient tomb of the human Pharaoh Poobah, who struck an evil deal with a wraith called Terrormisu to induce a great famine on his populace in exchange for an infinitely powerful Wishtone. Before the deal could be struck, Pharoah Poobah was instead betrayed by Terrormisu and entombed in his own palace for his sins. Bombats were set up in the tomb by Terrormisu using arcane black magic, bioengineering, and chemical warfare.

This is a Bombshell Koopa. Closely related to the Koopa Troopa and capable of breeding with other Koopas, Bombshell Koopas are quadripedal with black shells. They are hot-headed and short-tempered, and get their name from the fact that they will explode if too much pressure is applied at once on their shells.

As Dry Bones are to living Koopa Troopas, so too are Bony Beatles to living Buzzy Beatles. Also known as Dry Buzzy Beatles, these fully sapient, zombified remains haunt ruins, graveyards, and tombs across the Mushroom World. They retain their original personality, allegiance, and memories.

This is a Boo, the most common type of ghost in the Mushroom World. Boos are weak independently but can amass unmatched strength when congregated closely together. Boos exist on every continent and in every culture in the ubitiqous Ghost Houses and haunted mansions all across the planet. Weak Boos, called Boo Buddies, cannot look upon the living without freezing up in fear, unlike their larger kin. All hostile Boos, regardless of location, are lead by the King Boo, a greedy, iron-fisted, absolute monarch of obsecene wealth and ambition.

Also called "Boo Blah", Booblahs are spirits which lie in wait to startle their prey, suddenly jumping out and screeching in order to disorient them for their attacks and consumption. Unlike many other types of ghosts, Booblahs are fully temporal and can be touched, or even consumed by creatures such as Yoshis.
This is a Boo Guy, the spirit form of a Shy Guy. They behave as Shy Guys do and wield few ghostly abilities aside from flight, and retain their original personality, allegiance, and memories.
This is a Borp. Borps are little, sapient, bush-like creatures bearing flowers, native to Cavi Cape.

This is a Boss Bass: an adult, male Cheep Cheep nearing the end of its maximum lifespan. Its female equivalent is the BIG BERTHA. Boss Basses are among the fiercest fish in the sea, capable of eating creatures exceeding six feet in height in one gulp. Unlike sharks and other carniverous fish, Boss Basses openly seek out and attempt to devour prey on land. Boss Basses will brag about what they consumed to their friends and have, on rare occasions, even eaten Cheep Cheeps that are not their spawn. Firecely loyal to their mate and their spawn, Boss Basses are the nightmarish creatures that sailors tell their children about on a dark and stormy night. Most Cheep Cheeps do not live long enough to become Boss Basses or BIG BERTHAS.

This is a Bow Balloon. Bow Balloons form warrior castes and are expertly trained in all forms of archery. A Bow Balloon is a valuable asset if a Bullet Bill launcher, Tank, or other firearm is not at one's disposal.

This is a Bowser. Bowsers are an extremely rare, feared, prestigious type of Koopa denoted by their spiked shells, sheer size, and organizational skills. They possess unmatched strength, can breathe fire, and are natural-born commanders of legions of armies. Bowsers possessing horns are considered destined to govern by all Koopas and enjoy their admiration. \nWait, what's that? Yes, Bowsers are named after Bowser Koopa, King of Dark Land. King Bowser was the first, and only, creature of any type to ever unite the sporadic, diverse creatures of Dark Land. Due to this, Bowser's species become synonymous with fear, respect, and devotion to his troops. For Koopas of all stripes, to be a Bowser Koopa is to be blessed.
This is a Brock, the metallic, living brick-shaped entity native to Pi'illo Island and co-dominant with its eternal enemy, the Pi'illo race.

This is a Brolder. Brolders are massive rock entities that manuever by rolling. When under attack, they will retreat into their "shell" in order to withstand hits. Brolders can be picked up when they have withdrawn into themselves
This is a Broozer, an aggressive, punching spirit. Unlike many ghosts Broozers are completely temporal and thus can be touched..... which also means they can "touch" the living. Painfully.

This is a Bullet Bill. As their name suggests, Bullet Bills (which are not always male) are literally sapient, flying bullets capable of great speed. Bullet Bills can hover in the air and move very slowly under their own power, but in order to achieve maximum velocity and power, they must be launched from an artillery cannon. The largest known Bullet Bill is the fearsome Bonzai Bill, which can plough through entire buildings at a time.
This is a Bully: a brutish, powerful, horned, spherical entity that got its name for its hateful, territorial mindset.
This is a Bumbleprod, a horned varient of the Spiny. While being closely related to the Spiny, Bumbleprods cannot produce fertile offspring with Spinies, meaning they are in fact a separate species.

This is a Burt. Burts are cheerful, clownish, social creatures whose main interest is frolicking and playing. For some reason, however, they are fiercely hated by Yoshis. Only giant Burts are a threat to most life.
Buzzes are advanced, sapient, mechanical bee sentries built for defense of strategic locations.

This is a Buzzy Beatle. Buzzy Beatles are a type of Koopa with an extremely thick shell, and are, in fact, not any form of beatle. Buzzy Beatles are extraordinarily perceptive and impervious to being stepped on.
A Capnap is an armless, healthy, bleary creature normally found sleeping. Even when awake, they pose little threat.

This is a Cataquack, a flightless bird capable of throwing objects for yards, or directly upward for dozens of feet. Historically, they were used as living siege engines when Isle Delfino came under attack.

This is a Centipede. Centipedes are massive, biologically immortal, insect-like creatures consisting of sixteen segments plus their head. Absent knives, artillery, and explosives, no known natural attack, such as breathing fire, a Yoshi Egg or stomping, can harm them. They do not have one hundred legs.

This is a Chain Chomp. Chain Chomps are attack dogs in the Mushroom World and almost never possess any higher intelligence or speech. Normal Chain Chomps are encased in an exoskeleton of metal, but more ancient Chain Chomps of stone also exist. Chain Chomps hold no allegiance except to a benevolent owner. For wicked masters, Chain Chomps are loyal only when they are not allowed to roam free. As their name suggests, a Chain Chomp, regardless of opinion of its master, is only an effective line of defense when bound to a stationary object. Chain Chomps that are mistreated or abused will always turn on their owners if unchained or released from a controlling spell.
This is a Charging Chuck, a type of burly Koopa known for its athleticism, charismatic teamwork, comraderie, and sportsmanship. Not all Charging Churcks are named Chuck, nor are they all male.

This is a Cheep Cheep. Cheep Cheeps are a type of fish that spend the vast majority of their lives in a small, juvenile state. Cheep Cheeps that live extraordinarily long lives ultimately mature to Boss Basses if they are male, and BIG BERTHAS if they are female.
This is a Cherbil. Cherbils are bizzarely shaped, floating creatures consisting of chemicals that, when inhaled or ingested, induce immediate slumber.

This is a Choppah, a gentle insect capable of sustained, hovering, flight. Its method of flying is unique to all other known insects in that it roates its wings in full circles around its bodies, like its namesake's rotors. GET TO THE CHOPPAH!
This is a Chuckorok, a living stone that shoots other stones from its mouth. It is native to the Chucklehuck Woods.

This is a Chuckya. Though it is a type of Bob-omb, it is incapable of any form of detonation. Instead, it demonstrates spectacular strength, capable of picking up almost any movable object imaginable. It earned its name for its incredible throwing arm, which it gleefully uses on objects it grabs.

Clefts are living stones, comprised of wrock, metal ore, or iron. They are biologically immortal and can only be killed by being broken. The rarest Clefts, called Iron Clefts, are made of an iron alloy that is stronger than steel and harder than diamonds: the only way to injure Iron Clefts is with another Iron Cleft. Clefts do not need to breathe and thrive in any location where rocks exist. Clefts have even been found on natural moons in space.
This creature is some sort of living cloud or water vapor-based organism. Most cloud-creatures can fly.

This is a Cluster. Clusters lurk in dark caverns and cover themselves in hard crystals to withstand being hit or stepped on, which they can remove if the need arises. They are capable of storing immense power in a one-shot attack, but if they exert themselves too much, they will explode.

This is a Coalbit. Coalbits are primarily composed of carbon and resemble coal ore. They exist in a symbiotic relationship with the Choomba. Coalbits will jump into Choombas and combust themselves. After being burnt up by a Choomba, the Choomba will expel a Coalbit's ashes, which will then dissolve into coal ore and form new Coalbits. As such, both Coalbits and Choombas are almost always located only where coal is abundant, and frequent mines both as employees and looters. Choombas and Coalbits not in coal-rich areas will migrate to these areas when they need to reproduce.

This is a Com Bat, an intimidating, hostile creature most commonly found in the Great Neuron Jungle and the upper echelons of the Tall Tower. During the Kamek-Kammy Regency, they were also located in the underaged Bowser's sprawling castle complex.

This is a Conkdor. Conkdors are a long-necked bird with an extremely thick skull. It is capable of crushing prey under its beak or neck using its powerful neck muscles, which also exposes it to injury through snapping its neck. Conkdors are native to Conkdor Canyon.
This is a Coocoo. Coocoos are flighted poultry native to Isle Delfino. They are a major staple in the Delfinite cuisine.
This is Corkpedite, believed to be golem machine comprised of sandstone and cork. Unlike many machines, Corkpedites are not immortal and may actually be a biological rock entity.
This creature is some form of crab. Not all crabs in the Mushroom World are sapient.

This is a Craw. Craws are native to the Rogueport area and are historically the enemies of Piantas and members of the Al Koopone crime families. Like many creatures endemic to Rogueport, or residing therein, Craws have a propensity towards thievery.
This unfortunate creature is a Crook. Like Bandits, so closely are Crooks linked to thievery that historians and taxonomists have always named their entire species after their principle occupation.

This is a Crayzee Dayzee. Crayzee Dayzees are notoriously aggressive, sapient flowers found on Yoshi's Island, in the Twilight Woods, and in Flower Fields. Their rulers are known as Amayzy Dayzees, named after the extremely rare varient of their species that possesses unparalleled strength akin to Bowsers and Kongs.

This is a Digga: a living drill that feeds on rocks. Like Clefts, Diggas do not need to breathe and are capable of dwelling anywhere a rocky surface exists. Diggas have even been found in outer space.

Historically known as Ding-a-Lings, the Dingaling is a sapient, floating bell possessing psychic powers and extensive mechanical skills and knowledge. Originally, Dingalings were extradimensional creatures endemic to Smithy's Factory. Dingalings are one of the few creatures traditionally serving Smithy that are not machines.

This creature's ancestors hail from the forsaken dimension of Dinohattan. They breached the Portal in a desparate attempt to survive and expand, for their original homeland was a wasteland with few remaining settlements outside the titular capital, which is diseased and choked by the Great Fungus. With their world decaying, their homeland's military overthrew the dying monarchy and instilled a brutal junta under a "President Koopa", who has no relation to any Koopa of the Mushroom World. Despite being the cause of the Great Fungus, the President nonetheless promised green pastures and places to live, with the pollution and death of Dinohattan sealed behind them. \nAn abomination to all life of this dimension, the Dinohattanites are cold-blooded men of reptillian origin, their closest relative in the Mushroom World being the Rexes of Dinosaur Land and the Yoshis. Their varying constituent species are seen as grotesque caricatures of man, reptile, and mushroom alike.

This creature is some form of dinosaur. In the Mushroom World, dinosaurs are abundant and come in innumerable sizes, shapes, colors, and degrees of sentience. They are most abundant in Dinosaur Land, but exist all across the Mushroom World. From the fearsome, non-sapient Tyranosaurus Rex that haunts the countryside of Dinosaur Land to the small, dragon-like Rexes and the highly advanced, pacifistic Yoshis, a traveller spotting a living, breathing dinosaur is simply a matter of time.
This is a Doogan. Doogans, while strongly resembling Yoshis, are actually canids, bearing more instinctual and cultural resemblances to dogs than dinosaurs.

This creature is some form of dragon. The most abundant form of dragon in the Mushroom World is the lava-dwelling Blargg (not to be confused with the Gargantua Blarg of Yoshi Island, which is a magma-based Nep-Enut), although some taxonomists consider this to be a dinosaur. However, many other dragons exist, like the fearsome Bone Dragons of Yoshi Island, the Spine Coasters of magma pits around the world, and even classical dragons mirroring those known to the extradimensional, allegedly ancestral Earthling humans.
This creature was a Koopa Troopa. Was.

This is a Duplighost. Duplighosts possess extraoridinary shapeshifting abilities, making them among the best Intriguers known to the Mushroom World. However, when not taking the form of another, their attacks are next to nothing.

This creature is some form of eel, and is not to be confused with a Mister Eel. The most common type of eel is the orange varient located in dark caverns around the Kitchen Islands, but other eels exist all across the seas of the Mushroom World, some of which grow to monstrous size.
Eeries are ghostly, undead dinosuars native to Dinosaur Land. They live in most Ghost Houses in that area, though their allegiance to the King Boo is debatable.
This is an egg, and in it is some unborn creature. What is inside it and how it came to be depends on a huge array of diverse circumstances.
This creature is primarily made up of energy or electrical current.
BE CAREFUL! IF YOU PINCH WENDY'S PENNIES, THEY PINCH BACK.
This is an Eyepi'illo. Bearing no known relation to the true Pi'illo race, Eyepi'illos lie in wait until their prey is close enough to be shot by its lasers.

This creature is some sort of fairy. Fairies take numerous forms and have numerous powers and origins, but all are distinguished by a humanoid resemblence, the capability of flight, and magical powers.

This creature is primarily comprised of fire and magic. Ranging from the vicious Angry Sun to the wandering Hot Foot that patrols dark corridors, these diverse creatures can burn those who touch them and demonstrate impressive heat and power.
This creature is simply a fish, and is not a varient of Cheep Cheep, Blurp, shark, Fishbone, or any other fish-based lifeform.

This is a Fishbone. Fishbones are skeletal, undead relatives of the Cheep Cheep that are extremely difficult to harm. Fishbones have even been discovered in outer space, where they are particularly bloodthirsty and aggressive compared to their terrestrial counterparts.

This is a Fizzlit. Fizzlits are most common in outer space, but have been located in the Mushroom World near high waterfalls and rushing rivers. Fizzlits are cube-shaped creatures that possess the ability to stun and electrocute potential threats.

This is a Flaptack. These birds are notable for their inability to be stepped on and their head-first diving manuevers against their prey. Flaptacks that miss their prey when diving will be stuck in the ground, where their vulnerable underbelly is exposed.
Who left this delicious pastry here? One should consider eat- wait. Is that thing TALKING? It seems that the cake's edibility was a lie.

This is a Fronk. Fronks are proud, extremely intelligent creatures gifted in machinery, administration, and mathematics. Although they bristle at being deemed "pets", most Fronks are not wholly independent or autonomous in their living arrangements. Fronks are native to the countryside of Diamond City and thrive within urban areas.

This is a Fuzzball Ghost: a docile, playful spirit that latches onto the living and physically slows them down. Although Fuzzball Ghosts have no biological or magical relation to Fuzzies, the two species consider each other to be potential allies.

Fuzzies are vampiric leeches that latch onto other lifeforms and consume small amounts of their blood, Vim, or life force for sustinence. Fuzzies cannot attack any form of Koopa if they are donning their shell. While indisputably sapient, the Fuzzy civilizations are primitive, tribal, and mob-based. Their leaders are called Big Fuzzies, named after the rarer super-sized Fuzzies, although most Fuzzy chieftans are not actually larger. Fuzzies are vermin by nature. Originally infesting treetops, jungles, and deep forests, they also swarm over artificial structures. When wiring, beams, and transportation platforms are erected to float in mid-air, Fuzzies will use their tree-climbing abilities to latch on them and start patrolling the wires, hoping unsuspecting prey will encounter them.

Galoombas are a type of Goomba that behave and look more like chestnuts or plants than the visibly fungal-based Goomabs. However, they are genetically in the same taxonomic family as Goombas, closely related, even though they cannot reproduce any form of offspring with other Goombas.

This is a Gelatinous Ghost. Comprised of a spirit possessing gel, jelly, jam, gook, or goo, they manifest most commonly in sewers, cannaries, and other locations where large masses of gel and jelly are found. They were first discovered in the Yoshi Island archipelago, where they dwelled in the Jelly Pipe: a ruinous maze of broken pipes and caverns that may have been a part of Kamek's castle or a Koopa civilization predating the Yoshis.

A djinn (pronounced "jen" and better known by its plural form, "genies" or "djinni", pronounced identically to each other) is a powerful, humanoid being comprised of smoke and magic. Genies require a vessel in order to retain a physical form, preferring metal containers like brazen oil lamps. In the Mushroom World, genies have the power to grant wishes and are most commonly known for escourting those lucky enough to find their lamps to the location of a Power Star. The most powerful genies, respectively, are the Mushroom Djinn and the antithetical Mushroom Jeanie. All genies use the traditional folk magic of the Mushroom World, known as the white Mushroom-Kadabra and the black Fungus Pocus. Bowser, in his first true invasion of the Mushroom Kingdom, would later employ Fungus Pocus to entomb the denizens of that land in blocks.

This is a Glurp. Glurps are gelatinous beings that are extremely resistant to most types of physical attacks, vulnerable primarily to fire. Glurps are native to area around the Joke's End Palace in the Beanbean Kingdom.

This is a Gobblin Bubble. Gobblin Bubbles are actually solid balls. Members of this species are almost always absolute pacifists and, thanks to their durability, are able to live a quiet life. Even if they are struck, hit, or attacked, the penetration of a Gobblin Bubble is next to impossible, and they will simply roll around until they come to rest. No Gobblin Bubble has ever been seen eating or drinking, and they rarely speak.

A Gooey Goon is a gelatinous, subterreanen creature that affixes itself to the ceilings of caves and lies in wait for its prey. Gooey Goons, while presumed sapient, are not known to form civilizations or travel outside of caves.

This is a Goom. Bearing no relation of any sort to Goombas, Gooms are the dominant species of the Kitchen Islands and are traditionally pirates, criminals, and shady merchants. The most abundant type of Goom is the Wandering Goom, although the rarer Bandinero Gooms (which cannot produce fertile offspring with a Wandering Goom) also exist. The largest civilization of Gooms is in fact a pirate fleet under the command of Captain Syrup and her Black Sugar Gang. Gooms traditionally wield spears for ceremony and defense, but Gooms loyal to Captain Syrup are distinguished by their bandanas and use of three-pronged pitchforks.

This is a Goomba. Goombas are among the most abundant creatures in the Mushroom World and are known for their distinctive eyebrows, fangs, and fungoid appeaarence. Goombas originally lived in peace with Toads in the Mushroom Kingdom, but the unification of Dark Land under King Bowser caused most of them to revolt and join the newfound enemy. Traditionally, Goombas were the working underclass of the Mushroom Kingdom under the middle, upper, and servile classes of Toads. Goombas, despite being as advanced as Toads, traditionally clinged to their tribal governance and deep, personal kinship with other Goombas. Goombas are extremely social creatures that form tight-knit bonds with family, friends, and brothers-at-arms. Among Koopas and Bowser's minions, Goombas are seen as the bedrock of loyalty to the Dark Land Crown and the ones most devoted to Bowser's cause. As the tribal governments of Goomba civilizations were diverse and had varying social conditions, no Goomba in the Koopa Troop will tell the same story as to why they rebelled.

This is a Goombo. Goomboes are extremely closely related to Goombas, and are distinguished by their timidity, lack of eyebrows, smaller fangs, and wide, rounded caps. They are native only to Sarasaland, where they generally replace the otherwise ubitiquous Goombas found in the rest of the Mushroom World. During Tatanga's invasion of Sarasaland, Goomboes refused to side with either kingdom.

Goomboos are the spirits of long-departed Goombas with unfinished business. As most Goombas die at peace or serving a cause they love, seeing a Goomboo is an extremely rare and unusual occurence. They are most commonly found in the Pumpkin Zone, but can theoretically exist anywhere. Goomboos can only be harmed by Starmen and Koopa shells.

This is a Goombrat. Goombrats are distantly related to the Goombas but cannot breed with any other Goomba. Distinguished by their absence of eyebrows, flat, downward-pointing teeth, and persimmon-shaped head, they otherwise have the same abilities and instinctual behaviors as Goombas. Like Goombas, they too rebelled against the Mushroom Kingdom and sided with the Koopa Troop.
This is a Goonie Bird. Goonie Birds are slow, flighted, and generally aloof birds. Stepping on them will cause them to shed their wings and run along the ground.

Grombas are rock entities bearing extremely similar behaviors, appearences, and instincts to that of Goombas. They are native to the Pi'illo Islands. Most taxonomists and biologists believe that they have convergent evolution with Goombas and bare no relation or ancestor to Goombas. Unlike Galoombas, Goomboes, and Goombrats (as well as other Goomba varients), Goombas themselves do not consider them one of their own. For the purposes of this game, however, Grombas are classified with Goombas for coding and flavor purposes.
I still have flashbacks to that night at Big Boo's Haunt. That piano... THAT PIANO!

This is a Hobgoblin. Hobgoblins are undead, lantern-bearing spirits that somewhat resemble scarecrows. They are never seen without their light source and are generally docile if unprovoked. They consider Lantern Ghosts to be kindred spirits and share an instinctive bond with them.

This is a Hoohooligan. Thse ancient, cactus-like beings are known for their great wisdom. Their civilization predates the Beanbean Kingdom and possibly even the Mushroom Kingdom. Extraordinarily long-lived and docile, Hoohooligans are native solely to the Hoohoo Mountains of Teehee Valley.

Huffinpuffins are social, chick-rearing birds most known for their deep family bonds and motherly protection. Huffinpuffin chicks stay by their mother for life, unless they volunteer to serve a Yoshi or other species in need of their services. Huffinpuffins are incapable of injury when they are thrown, and while they are not truly flighted birds, they can use their arm-like wings to return to where they were thrown.

Men, better known as Humans, are tall, prestigious, mammalian creatures with a propensity for rulership. Although the largest concentration of men is in New Donk City, as well as sizable locations in Diamond City and cultural enclaves of the Mushroom Kingdom (where the Mario Brothers grew up), the species has ruled the Mushroom Kingdom since the ascension of the adopted Princess Peach, and Sarasaland since Princess Daisy, and have ruled the seven constituent vassalages of the Mushroom Kingdom for far longer.\nAs the only significant mammalian population aside from Ukikis and Kongs, their unique traits hint at extradimensional origins: it is known that at least one other, bizzare dimension is dominated by humanity- a planet called "the earth" -and that this dimension has laws of physics and nature totally alien to reality. This world has been visted by Mario and Luigi before, but details about it are almost entirely mythical. Even the Mario Brothers can't really describe much about it aside from its exotic landmarks and bizzare physics.
This creature is comprised entirely or mostly of living, magic-infused ice. They are weak to heat and fire and have close originating ties to other water beings.
This is a giant, sapient insect of some sort.

This is an Ishsnail Koopa, closely related but distinct from Koopa Troopas in that they have snail shells and antennae. They are slower than normal Koopas and are incapable of removing their shell. Ishnail Koopas migrated from Dark Land eons ago after being rejected by the Koopas of Dark Land. The largest concentration of Ishnail Koopas in one location is in Rogueport. The Robbo Gang is the most prominant representation of Ishnail Koopas, for better or worse. Outside of the Odyssey Continents, Ishnail Koopas are among the last widespread practitioners of the indigineous, pre-Bowser Koopa paganism in the Mushroom World. Ishnail Koopas cannot breed with other Koopas.

This is a Jelectro. Jelectroes are invulnerable, untouchable, immortal jellyfish creatures that constantly emit electrical currents, making them lethal to the touch by any creature besides themselves, ghosts, and creatures made of energy. By far the rarest jellyfish to ever exist, they are located primarily in the oceans of Water Land, one of the seven vassal states of the Mushroom Kingdom.

This is a Jinx. Jinxes are a race of quasi-humanoid martial artists and fighters that make up some of the greatest fighting forces in the Mushroom World. Totally unmatched on the battlefield and feared by all armies, one elite Jinx can defeat over three dozen enemy soldiers entirely on their own.

This is a Kaboomba. Kaboombas, despite their name, are an artificially created, magical, symbiotic relationship of organic flesh (mainly feet) and a metal body. They are literally walking, sapient cannons and, despite their name, have no relationship to any Goomba or other organic lifeform. Kaboombas are capable of speech and, like Goombas and many other bipedal creatures without hands, have telekinetic "hands" to interact with objects. Being magical constructs, Kaboombas cannot breed, relying solely on Storks to receive their young. They were created by Kamek for his vassal, Raphael the Raven, on Yoshi Island during the Kamek-Kammy Regency for then-Baby Bowser.

This is a Greater Kong, a type of huge, sapient, powerful, intelligent ape that is endemic to the Bongokongo Continent and closely related to the Lesser Kong monkeys. All Kongs are known for their amassing of bananas and wealth, and are as thrifty as they are fierce in battle. Most Kongs are not as intelligent as other sapient beings, and there is no kingdom or organized Kong civilization known to exist. Kongs instead form primitive, tribal clans of close-knit, beloved family members.

Lesser Kongs are the small, weaker cousins of Greater Kongs. Greater Kongs are apes, Lesser Kongs are monkeys. They are slightly smarter and vastly faster than their ape relatives and, like Greater Kongs, are known for their thrift, amassing of bananas, and lack of any organized civilization beuond tribal clans.
This is a Kanotoko, a living, flying bomb.

This is a Koopa Troopa. Koopa Troopas are the natives of Dark Land, the most abundant varient of Koopa, and the core constituency of the titular Koopa Troop. Koopa Troopas can be bipedal or quadripedal, possess a rainbow of shell colors, and though most Koopa Troopas are loyal to Bowser, sizable minorities of "good" Koopas are spread across the Mushroom World.

This is a Kremling. Kremlings are a variety of powerful, mostly bipedal crocodillians native to Crocodile Isle and its surrounding, gloomy archipelago. Most Kremlings owe their allegiance to the Kremling Krew, a horde of soldiers led by the undisputed Krocodile King, the great King Krudd Rool. Quadripedal Kremlings are called Klaptraps. Aside from Crocodile Island, Kremlings are also found across the Kongobongo Continent and in the conquered Northern Kremisphere. Vicious Klaptrap exclaves also terrorize swamps, especially in Down Under Land and its surrounding areas.

This is a Lakitu. Lakitus are a type of Koopa that have mastered flight through the mystical control of clouds. Most Lakitus have a team of Spinies that unquestionably serve them. While Lakitus can breed with other Koopas and produce fertile offspring, Lakitus are strikingly different in appearence. Lakitus are smaller and have more rounded shells. They cannot come out of their shell like most Koopas can.

This is a Lantern Ghost. Lantern ghosts are small, light-bearing, corporal, temporal spirits that can be struck by mortals and consumed by Yoshis. They are native to the deep, dark caverns of the Yoshi archipelago, but have been found in small amounts across the Mushroom World. Lantern Ghosts are flightless and cannot turn incorporal for extended periods of time, meaning most cannot pass walls beyond a certain thickness. Lantern Ghosts do not owe allegiance to any nation and are neutral entities, although some serve the King Boo. The largest specimins are called Big Lantern Ghosts and are generally much more cruel and mischevious than their normal counterparts.

This creature is either a Madpole or some type of tadpole (particularly the offspring of sapient frogs). Tadpoles are most commonly found at the Great Tadpole Pond, where their frog parents keep watch on them and educate them under the governance of Frogfucious. Madpoles are found across the Mushroom World and, unlike tadpoles, do not mature into frogs.

This creature is a spirit of a departed being, a servant of King Boo, or some other type of ghost or ectoplasmic, elemental, or spiritual being. Ghosts of this type are not some class of Boo or other distinct spiritual species. The most common spirits of this type are known as Mansion Ghosts, and they haunt abandoned buildings and Ghost Houses across the Mushroom World and even in outer space. They are followed by the far rarer Portrait Ghosts, who are almost always the restless spirits of decreased men. Like Boos, all ghosts of this class can be defeated with bright lights and vacuums.

This is a Manta Ray, stingray, or other saltwater or freshwater ray, composed only of cartilage and capable of dispensing healing rings from their behind. Manta Rays are pacifists and require water to survive. They are found throughout the Mushroom World, particularly in places like Dire Dire Docks and the Delfinite archipelago.

Marumen are handless, pacifistic creatures native to the jungles and caverns in and around the Pyramid of the Golden Diva. They are tribalistic and do not possess any significantly advanced society, although they are fully sapient and capable of speech.

This creature is a benign or benevolent microbe. Existing within the bodies of non-human, non-fungal, organic beings, many of these microbes are sapient and some serve their host much like the non-sapient microbes found in the digestive tracts of men. Most notably, the bodies of Koopas and all other reptilian beings (such as dinosaurs and Kremlings) possess the benign Emoglobins- the most common, sapient microbe -and the rare, symbiotic Evoglobins, which are the naturally created, organic guardians of a reptile's immortal soul. Like all microbes regardless of sentience, they are threatened by pathogens like the infamous and deadly, sapient Viruses, and are protected by the host's immune system.

A Midbus is a gargantuan pig with defensive, shelled armor on its back. Fiercely strong, they also possess a glaring paucity of intellignece, with most barely able to speak the English Common Tongue of the Mushroom World. Excluding extremely rare exceptions, Midbusses possess no civilization or tribe, and instead exist as solitary creatures looking only for a master to serve.
This is a Milde. Mildes are armless, peaceful wanderers native to Yoshi Island. They pose no threat but are considered delicacies by the Yoshi population.

This is a Minotaur: a creature with the head of a bull and the body of a humanoid or extremely muscular Toad. Minotaurs are native to Mount Teapot and the Kitchen Islands. The largest, strongest, and most well-known Minotaur is Bifun.

This is a Missile Bill. Also known as Bulls-Eye Bills, Missile Bills are advanced Bullet Bills denoted by their flashing nose cone or bodies. Though all Bullet Bills can turn or hover in the air, they cannot travel quickly without being launched. This is where Missile Bills differ from their counterparts. Missile Bills are capable, after being launched, of turning around at and resuming travel at launch speed. Bullet Bills, when launched at full speed, can only travel straight. As with Bullet Bills, Missile Bills are fully sapient.

This is a Warpman: all females are called Miss Warps and all males are called Mister Warps, even when they marry. They are never referred to as Warpmen outside of taxonomy and scientific classification of the species itself. Warpmen are a psychically powerful, interconnected race of cheery, living checkpoints. If a traveller comes into contact with a sleeping Warpman and wakes them (normally, this involves a Miss Warp and not a Mister Warp), they will activate and connect to psychic bonds with other Warpmen in the area. Jumping on top of them will allow the traveller to be launched into subspace and land in the presence of another Warpman within range. Warpmen are assigned numbers at birth, which represents the order in which travellers are teleported, from lowest to highest. These numbers need not be consequential. Warpmen are not actually men.

This is a Eelman: all males are called Mister Eels and all females are called Miss Eeels, even when they marry. They are never referred to as Eelmen outside of taxonomy and scentific classification of the species itself. Eelmen differ drastically in appearence with normal eels, boasting diverse neon colors and large lips. While other eels are found throughout the Mushroom World, Eelmen exist only in tropical waters, particularly in and around the Yoshi Island archipelago.

This is a Money Bag, a fully sapient, living wallet. Money Bags are short-lived, physically weak creatures that produce coins in their body and horde them. They make expert administratiors, but their short lifespan makes their service fleeting. Despite their intelligence and thrift, Money Bags are defenseless and can only hop away when attacked. Due to their ability to literally produce gold in their bodies, they are largely an endangered species, protected by law in some areas and hunted by others. Everyone, even Mario, wants a piece of their loot.

This is a Monolift. Monolifts are rock-based beings capable of picking up, balancing, and throwing boulders in spite of their absence of arms. Extremely territorial and hostile to outsiders, Monolifts are native to the Pajamaja Mountains of the Pi'illo Island chain.

This creature is some form of mole. All mole creatures live underground, are warm-blooded, and are mammalian, making them one of the few mammals to have appeared naturally in the Mushroom World. The most common form of mole in the Mushroom World is the Monty Mole and its varients. Most Monty Moles are tribal creatures that live in decentralized, familial clans, possessing no real advancement or modern concept of a nation-state. However, some moles abandon their more primitive civilizations and join the rest of society. When Monty Moles do this, they are known as Rocky Wrenches and are most commonly found in service to Bowser. Most mole tribes determine their leaders by sheer size: the largest Monty Moles, for instance, are called Mega Moles and wear sunglasses as a symbol of authority. Mega Moles can grow as tall as six feet and dig tunnels the size of caves, inhabitable by almost any creature.

This is a Little Mouser. Little Mousers, also called Squeeks, are rare examples of naturally formed mammals in the Mushroom World. They thrive in warm climates, such as the Dry Dry Desert, the Yoshi Island archipelago, and Rogueport. As their name suggests, they stand approximately two feet six inches (around half the size of Mario without a Super Mushroom) and are generally weak creatures when alone. The largest Little Mousers have only been seen in dreams, and may not actually exist: these are capable of throwing bombs and stand around seven feet tall. Desert-dwelling Little Mousers, and those of Dryite culture, are called Nomadimice.

This is a Muddy Buddy. Muddy Buddies are armless, hairy, extremely thick-skinned creatures capable of walking on spikes, nails, and other otherwise lethal services. They can be ridden on for safe passage across hazardous terrain.

This is a Nabbit. Like Bandits, Bandineros, and Crooks, Nabbits are so closely associated with thievery that they are named after their primary profession. One's average Nabbit will not hesitate to steal anything on another's person.

This is a Neuron. Neurons are neon colored, docile, sedentary, highly intelligent worms native to the Great Neuron Jungle of Yoshi Island, and other rainforests in its surrounding archipelago. Terrestrial Neurons can grow to tens of feet in length. An aquatic Neuron is called Sea Cactus.

This creature is an abomination to all sapient beings, living and dead. It may possess unmatched black magic, be demonic, or otherwise be incompatible or comprehensible with and within the known universe. One of the all-time most famous examples of such abominations is the Shadow Queen, sealed away beneath Rogueport by ancient heroes many millinea ago.

This is a Nimbus Cloud. Nimbus Clouds are native to the Kingdom of Nimbus Land, which sits in the sky and is accessible from its ground-side demense by many vines. Nimbus Clouds wield powerful magic but are generally docile. Without access to their magic, they pose no threat.

This is a Ninji: a stealthy, light footed, small creature found scattered across the Mushroom World in small numbers. Ninjis are poor fighters, for their primary attack, in the open, is jumping up and down. Instead, as their name suggests, Ninjis use stealth and subterfuge to assassinate their enemies and otherwise reak havoc in the shadows, where they are unseen and not anticipated.

This is a Noki. Nokis are pacifistic, gentle creatures that carry conch shells on their backs. They are native to Noki Bay and its surrounding islands, and peacefully coexist with the more abundant Piantas.

Nommons are purple, mole-like creatures native to Pi'illo Island. In ancient times, they were harmonious with the Pi'illo race, but over the ages they have come to be mortal enemies. The Pi'illos proved themselves to be the dominant race of their island by blood, consigning the Nommons to the remote Somnom Woods.
