column2: This is an Octoboo: the spirit of a deceased Octoomba. Like its living counterpart, Octoomboos (and Octoombas) are a distant, alien relative of the Goomba. How they got into space and evolved Snifit-like shooting abilities has never been determined.

This is an Octoomba. An Octoomba is an extraterrestrial being named after its Snifit like face, which bears a resemblance to the true octopi found in the Mushroom World. Octoombas, remarkably, are genetically related to Goombas. Goomba DNA and Octoomba DNA are close enough to prove a complete common ancestor existed, but how Octoombas got into space and evolved Snifit-like shooting abilities has never been determined.

This is an octopus. Octopi in the Mushroom World are sapient and possess immense intelligence, dexterity, and manuverability. They can regrow limbs, survive physical trauma from direct attacks, power ups, and magic, and can constrict themselves through pipes the size of the average man's wrist. A typical octopus grows larger than the pirate galleons that haunt the Mushroom World's seas, and could better be described as the mythical Krakens from the mystical, extradimensional human world of "the earth".

This is an Oho Jee, which is an average, flightless avian creature. Most members of this species also happen to be CONSTANTLY ON FIRE. Oho Jees are distinguished, aside from the flames literally consuming their head yet never extinguishing, by their panicking, constantly flailing means of attack and eternal state of terror, which makes them run everywhere they go. Oho Jees are literally driven mad by the fires that keep them panicked, making them unstable, unpredictable rulers and useful commanders. Eventually, the fires are what will kill an Oho Jee.

This is a pathogen: a hostile microbe that exists only to reproduce, while also happening to cause illness. While normal, single-sell pathogens like bacteria are present in the Mushroom World, complex beings with eyes, hands, feet, and mouths also exist. The latter, simply called the Viruses (though true viruses they are not), are sapient and cause three of the four great plagues of the Mushroom World: the Great Fever, the Great Chills, and the Weird Disease, which typically causes drowsiness and short-term deformation. While normal pathogens can be defeated by traditional medical practices, the sapient Viruses can only be effectively destroyed by Megavitamins, which also have the ability to cure any known ailment.
This is a penguin. Penguins are flightless, obnoxious birds native to cold areas in the Mushroom World such as Shiver City and Cool, Cool Mountain.

This is a Phantamanta. Phantamantas are gargantuan, polluting, lethal spirits that arise in Isle Delfino if the Shine Spirites are scattered and the island is polluted. They secrete toxic waste emmitting powerful electric currents, which can be washed awayh with an extremely powerful pressure-washer. The more a Phantamanta is allowed to pollute, the more powerful it gets. It feeds on the life force of those who are electrocuted or poisoned by its waste secretions.

This is a Pianta. Piantas are large, pacifistic beings known for their spectacular corruption and maintenance of a dictatorship on Isle Delfino. Piantas are among the largest contributors to organized crime in the Mushroom World but, in spite of their immense corruption, Piantas that go straight are strongly committed to non-violence (especially against almost all foreigners) and to tolerance of others.

This is a Pi'illo. Pi'illos are the dominant species and namesake of Pi'illo Island and its archipelago. They possess magical abilities based around slumber, lucid dreaming capabilities, and they can transform into pillows, which serve as portals to an extradimensional plane. Modern Pi'illos are committed to nonviolence and spirituality, but in ancient times, Pi'illo armies vanquished their fellow harmonious natives turned sworn enemies, the Nommons, and consigned them to the remote Somnom Forest. Pi'illos are the traditional guardians of the Dream Stone and Dark Stone, which autonomously grant wishes and maintain stability of all life while in REM sleep.

A Pionpi is a humanoid, aggressive spirit native to the Chai Zone of Sarasaland. Like a Dry Bones, they will return to attack even if stepped on. When Tatanga invaded Sarasaland and captured Daisy, the Pionpies betrayed their liege and sided with the alien menace.

This is a Piranha Plant. Piranha Plants are abundant, carniverous flowers- most of which are sapient -that possess immense biting force and an insatiable appetite. Most types of Piranha Plant must be rooted in either soil or a pipe to survive, and only resort to photosynthesis if they are starving. Piranha Plants that spit fire are called Venus Fire Traps, and other related varients (such as Munchers, the distantly related, mobile Ptooies and Stalking Piranha Plants, and the fearsome Lava Piranhas) infest every corner of the Mushroom World. One of the largest Piranha Plant jungles lies in Pipe World, one of the constituent, vassal kingdoms of the Mushroom Kingdom. Piranha Plants and their related species can stand as small as one foot to multiple stories tall. In tropical areas, most Piranha Plants form tribes under the control of a Lava Piranha, while temperate Piranha Plants either form local clans or serve Petey Piranha. Some Piranha Plants and their subspecies are even capable of locomotion. Locomotive Piranha Plants are called Stalking Piranha Plants unless they are a Ptooie.

This is a Pixl. Pixls are long-lived, ethereal lifeforms created by the Tribe of Ancients millinea ago using the Dark Prognosticus, to serve as "thinking tools" that overcame the Ancients' spiritual limitations, allowing them to interact with physical matter and erect structures to dwell in. Pixls were created to serve, but in around Year -85, the first Pixl led a rebellion that slaughtered most of the Ancients. This Pixl Revolt lead to the creation of the Tribe of Darkness, which stole the Dark Prognosticus with the intent of ensuring it would never be used again, under any circumstance.

This is a plant, and it may not neccesarily be sapient. Unlike Piranha Plants, normal plants "eat" solely by photosynthesis: the converting of sunlight and water into sugary energy. Despite having rigid cell walls, they, like Piranha Plants, are often capable of fluid and slithery motion and even locomotion.
This is a Plessie, the aerial counterpart to the Dorrie. Plessies are flying dinosaurs that provide transportation to land-based creatures across the Mushroom World.

This is a Podaboo. Also called Lava Bubbles, Podaboos are sapient beings of living fire and molten rock. When submerged in magma or lava, they can be distinguished from the lava as little "bubbles" of life essence and their eyes.

Poinks are sapient animals capable of flight, renowned for their voracious appetites and ability to expand dramatically in diameter. They can store immense quantities of food, water, and other items without digesting it, using their bodies for luggage and transport. However, if they are stomped on while expanded and storing items, they will explode instantly and painfully.

This is a Pokey. Pokeys are sapient cacti comprised of multiple spiked segments. Like most plants, sapient or otherwise, Pokeys "feed" by photosynthesis but, despite their rigid cell walls, are fully capable of locomotion. They boast extraordinary longevity and resistance to attacks due to their segmented nature. When an individual segment is severed, a Pokey's overall body is unharmed, and the segment will always grow back.

This is a Porcupinefish, a carniverous, heavily spiked group of fish closely related to the various types of puffer fish and pufferfish-like Cheep Cheeps throughout the seas of the Mushroom World. Porcupinefish are unique in their ability to temporarily paralyze potential threats or prey.
You are not supposed to be able to view this Trait. If you can see it, it is likely that you have added it through cheat codes or Events. (Mantis from "Wario Ware" was not an actual mantis.)

Ptooies are a rare type of Stalking Piranha Plant distinguished by its smaller size, lack of arms, strattled walking style, and consistent use of spiked balls. Ptooies can always be recognized by their juggling of spiked balls and the use of the same as missiles. Like Stalking Piranha Plants, they are capable of full locomotion and do not need to anchor to soil or a pipe for water.

This is a Puffer. Puffers are hyper-thermophiles native to volcanic calderas or magma chambers such as the Blaarg Boiler on Yoshi Island. They feed on magma and, when threatened, expel a natural substance that bursts in a great flash of light, briefly blinding their would-be predators, allowing them to escape. Puffers are considered a delicacy by Yoshis everywhere.

This is a Raven. Ravens are large, slow moving birds native to the Yoshi Island archipelago and the distant Lavalava Island. They possess the remarkable ability to latch onto any surface, even upside down, and remain firmly stuck to it, preventing them from falling off. All Ravens speak a common language, and their ambassadors and rulers are usually the only bilingual members of a Raven clan. Ravens are tribal in nature, and are ruled by gargantuan-sized members of their species, all of which are dubbed "Raphaels", regardless of gender. For Ravens, "Raphael" is both a name and a title. Ravens, for the most part, are flightless, but they can flap their wings for short spurts to escape predators. Raphaels, however, are capable of full airborne flight by flapping their feet.

The aptly named Sandoon is a creature with an exterior covered in sand and magic. Capable of merging with sand beneath them, Sandoons hunt using stealth, hiding in the sand with only their eyes exposed. They will then move closer and closer to their prey before rising up and devouring their prey whole.

This is a Sea Cactus, an aquatic Neuron. Like terrestrial Neurons, Sea Cacti are neon colored, docile, sedentary, highly intelligent worms. Where Neurons dwell in the Great Neuron Jungle and other rainforest climates on the Yoshi Islands, Sea Cacti are the among the largest creatures in the burgeoning coral reefs and lakes of the region. Despite being lined with spikes, Sea Cacti pose no threat unless they are touched- touching them without their permission will always cause HP damage, as they can secrete poison through their spikes -and do not actively attack any other creatures, though they are not hesitant to defend themselves and fellow Neurons if needed. Sea Cacti can live in both fresh and salt water.

This is a Shadow Siren, also known as a Shadow Sister. Coming in both male and female forms (despite their names), a Shadow Siren is a creature of comprised of dark energy and black magic, capable of withdrawing their temporal form and anything they are in contact with into their own, small shadow. They can also hide in the shadows of others and "ride" on a person this way. Shadow Sirens rank among the greatest Spymasters in the Mushroom World.

This is a Shadow Clone. "Shadow Clone" is a broad, umbrella term for creatures comprised of dark energy and black magic, and encompasses, among other things: creatures using powers of darkness to take the forms of others (Bowser II infamously deployed this trick as "Shadow Mario"), familiars dispatched by Shadow Spirits, and the legions of abominations under the command of the Shadow Queen or some other Nightmare Abomination. Shadow Clones are closely related to and can breed with Shadow Sirens.

Not to be confused with the religious title, the creature known as a Shaman is a member of a tribe of small, cloaked humanoids that possess significant psychic and magical energy. Their faces and physical features are hidden by their robes, and they possess glowing eyes. Most Shamans employ themselves in service as clergy in Astrotheology and lunar worship, or take up secular jobs as fortune tellers, diviners, oracles, and profits. Some hostile bands of Shaman sorcerers exist and roam the countryside wreaking havoc, but for the most part, Shamans are docile and focused on the spiritual realm.

A shark is a fish characterized by a cartilaginous skeleton, gill slits on the sides of the head, and prehensile, pectoral fins that are not fused to the head. Modern sharks are closely related to Manta Rays and other cartilaginous creatures in the seas of the Mushroom World. Unlike sharks on the extradimensional "earth", the pectoral fins of real sharks are tipped by dextrous hands with opposable thumbs. A shark normally bends his pectoral fins close to his torso to swim, and wears boxing gloves to render itself more hydrodynamic. Sharks attack with speed and grace, using their sharp skin to draw blood, then using their fists to pummel them until they are too weak to resist consumption. Alternately, they simply catch the creature with their hands and consume it with their fierce teeth.

This is a Shroob, an extraterrestrial, fungoid being that harvests the life force of other fungoid creatures for the purpose of powering their infrastructure, fleet of ships, and every day life. Escaping from their withering, dying home world, they have now sought to claim the Mushroom World as their new capital. Known for their spectacular cruelty- even to themselves -the Shroobs extract and engineer the Vim of other fungoids (with Toad Vim being the most potent) using bio-engineered trees to be used as fuel. In addition to extracting Vim, they can also use their energy weapons to transform any other living being into a purple, immobile Shroob Mushroom: this is called being "Shroobified". After their invasion was fended off, it was realized that Shroob rot, Shroob Mushrooms, and toadwood can all be killed or reverted by using the tears of infant men.

This is a Shy Guy, also known as a Shyguy. Shy Guys are small, masked creatures that hide their faces behind masks in modesty. As their name suggests, shyness is their defining trait and, consequently, most (but not all) types of Shy Guy are bashful and reluctant to interact with creatures unlike them. Most Shy Guys live in ancient, ritualistic tribal structures with defined rulers and roles, making their "states" more developed than many other "primitive" races. However, some Shy Guys have since modernized and evolved their society: the largest anti-tribal, contemporary government of Shy Guys is a stratocracy under the command of the General Guy. It is unknown what, if anything, is behind a Shy Guy's mask, but testimonies from the few who have seen the mask slip indicate that whatever it is, is horrific.

This is a Skeletal Dragon, that is, a dragon that has passed away and has since revived. Also called Bone Dragons, the most powerful of these undead dragons are, respectively, Bonetail, who is sealed in the Pit of a Hundred Trials to protect the Mushroom World from his wrath, and the vicious, hydra-like Bone Dragons that haunt the deepest caves of the Yoshi Island archipelago.

This is a Skipdrill. Skipdrills are conical, sharp entities native to the Pi'illo Dream Worlds, which are accessible by magical, psychic energy found in Pi'illoes. They have since exited the Pi'illo Dream Worlds and can now be found in and around the Pi'illo Island chain. Skipdrills are made entirely of metal and, like artificial machines, are immortal for as long as they are maintained. A Skipdrill hunts by drilling into the ceilings of caves, buildings, and rock formations. Though they are made of metal, they feed on organic meat. Skipdrills lie in wait until their prey comes in range, which is when they will drop on them with the hopes of impaling them or drawing them into a fight.
This creature is primarily composed of slime. Its biology is a mystery and is likely sustained by magic.

This creature is some form of slug. A slug is a shell-less, land-based, terrestrial, gastropodal mollusk. In essence, it refers to any gastropodal mollusk without a shell. Slugs are abundant in certain parts of the world, particularly in the Yoshi's Island archipelago, where they are neon-colored and grow to the size of automobiles.

This is an Unshaven Slugy. An Unshaven Sluggy is a specific type of long-lived slug characterized by its internal and external hair, proportionately huge heart, and lopsided build, with a significantly larger "head" and a thin "body". Unshaven Sluggies do not have eye stalks and are not resistant to salt. It is unknown why an Unshaven Sluggy's small body needs a heart as large as it does. How closely they are related to other gastropods in the Mushroom World, particularly "true" slugs and snails, is the subject of fierce academic debate.
This is a Smeech. Smeeches are aggressive, kissing orbs capable of flight. They are aliens, not native to the Mushroom World.

This is a snake, also known as a serpent. A snake is one of any form of elongated, legless, carniverous reptile. Snakes in the Mushroom World range from the small, abundant Cobrats, to gargantuan, rare, dungeon serpents larger than many busses. They also include the vase-dwelling Vipers of the Stagnant Swamp and Kitchen Islands, the colorful, flying serpents of the Yoshi's Island archipelago, and the Slippas of the Kongobongo Continents.

This is a Snifit, a type of Shy Guy with built-in artillery on their masks. Snifits exist in various climates, and a few extremely rare subspecies are capable of flight. A Snifit royal is called a Snifaro, which travels in a magical, flying sarcophagus. Snifaroes always wear a nemes headdress as a symbol of their office.

This creature is either a Snorkel Snake or its close relative, the far larger Dragoneel. Snorkel Snakes are spiked enemies which swim around their prey, trying (and failing) to fully encircle them and force them to touch their spikes until they are killed. Dragoneels hunt the exact same way as Snorkel Snakes but are capable of successfully ensnaring their prey due to their larger size. For the purpose of this game, Snorkel Snakes and Dragoneels are considered the same creature and can breed together, although with a different appearence

This is a living snowman. Living snowmen are sapient, humanoid snow sculptures capable of limited mobility and throwing snowball missiles. By far, the most abundant type of snowmen are the aggressive Mister Blizzards (female Mister Blizzards exist but the name is the same), but smaller and even docile living snowmen exist.

This is a Spearhead. Spearheads are small, blue, spherical creatures named after the large, stabbing proboscis that prominently juts from their face. Spearheads have tiny mouths underneath their huge spear proboscis and use their noses to skewer prey for consumption. Spearheads are not to be confused with Spear Masks, and doing so will greatly offend them both.

This is a Spear Mask. Spear Masks are small, humanoid spearmen and the mortal enemies of the Gooms. Unlike Wandering Gooms, they carry a one-pointed spear and bare no clothes, instead of the distinct fork and bandanas that the elite Pirate Goomes wield. Spear Masks are not to be confused with Spearheads, and doing so will greatly offend them both.

Eek! This character is a spider! Spiders are land-based, air-breathing arthropods, normally possessing between four and eight legs, with fangs capable of biting (though not all spiders bite). In the Mushroom World, spiders are the mortal enemies (and predators) of the insects and Punis. Spiders have a range of natural habitats, ranging from the huge, monochromatic Piders of the Boggly Woods to the four-legged Scuttlebugs of the pools and poisonous caverns, to the Snifit-like spiders of Turtlevania. No known, extant spider in the Mushroom World is venomous.

This is a Spike Koopa. Spike Koopas are stout, round Koopas that cannot withdraw into or take off their shells. Spikes are all named for their use of maces. The most common Spike attack is to literally regurgitate a previously swallowed mace and throw it. Spikes that do not employ this tactic, but instead wield maces as conventional weapons, are called Clubbas. The largest known Spike is Tubba Blubba. If done with the aid of powerful magic, a Spike can transfer its soul into its heart and remove it, rendering its former vessel invincible.
This Trait should not appear in the game.

This character is a Spiked Sentry. Spike Sentries are acorn-shaped creatures either made of metal or cloaked in incredibly strong armor. They can only be destroyed by Starman invincibility, magma, or lava. Some biologists believe they are closely related to the Taptap.

This character is a Spiny. Spinies are spiked Koopas that are almost always quadripedal. Spiny hatchlings are dispensed by Lakitus, with whom they have a symbiotic relationship. Lakitus incubate their eggs in the clouds. While almost all Spines are quadripedal, bipedal ones do exist. These are unusually rare and are referred to as a "False Spike Koopas" or "Key-pa-way Koopas", to differentiate them from "true" Spike Koopas. All spinies are instantly recognizable by their shell and tiny heads, the former being covered in spines and spikes. False Spike Koopas possess fangs and frog-like faces, and normally serve as watchmen over Bowser's smaller treasure hordes.

This is a Starbag, also called a Petapeta or Petari. Closely related to the Living Money Bag, Starbags carry Star Bits and gems instead of coins. They live in tropical regions and, despite having originated on the Mushroom World, were first discovered on exoplanets in deep space, having only recently returned to their home world. It is unknown when or why they left the planet all those years ago.

Behold the Star. To be a Star is to be divinity incarnate, a living god, and not to be confused with the burning ball of gas that gives off heat and light. In the Mushroom World, Stars wield the power to grant wishes, break spells and curses, unlock cursed doors, and protect the innocent.\n The main groups of Stars are the Star Spirits and Star Kids, the Star Sprites, the Power Stars, and the Starmen. The Star Spirits comprise the chief spot in the pantheon of Astrotheology and wield the Star Rod. Star Kids and Star Sprites are the servants of Star Haven and the Star Road. Power Stars wield unimaginable power to break curses, defeat Bowser at his peak, and even create life and galaxies. Power Stars are born as Lumas, where they are protected by Rosalina until they mature. The greatest and largest Power Stars are called Grand Stars. Starmen grant temporary invincibility to whoever picks them up.
This character has temporarily turned into a statue by the power of the Tanooki Suit. While in this form, they are completely invulnerable, immortal, and invincible.
This statue is possessed by a soul or spirit, watching the world around them. They don't do much and, for the purposes of the game, are unplayable.

This is a Stubird, better known simply as a "Stu". Stubirds are flighted birds that protect their vulnerable, fat torsoes in golden cauldrons and other armor. To attack, they drop the bombs stored in their cauldron. If a Stubird's protective armor is shattered, the bombs will its torso to shed its feathers and temporarily render the bird flightless.

This character is a Strolling Stu, a docile, quiet creature native to Isle Delfino. Biologists believe they split off from Galoombas millions of years ago, when they showed up on the isolated archipelagos of Isle Delfino. Strolling Stus are the only descendant of primordial Goombas that possess a nose, which covers their mouth. A "victim" of Insular Tameness, the lack of any natural predators (even after they, the Piantas, and Nokis reached sapience) caused them to shed their fangs and evolve into pacifistic, tolerant beings. Strolling Stus, like Goombas, can be flattened or even killed by  stomping. Like Goombas, Strolling Stus come in various flavors, can defend themselves better in numbers(like stacking on top of each other), and they can rarely have the capacity for flight. Strolling Stus cannot naturally reproduce with any known Goomba. Despite similar appearences, Strolling Stus have no relation to Burts and do not behave like Burts at all.

This is a Sworm. Sworms are black, burrowing, worm-like creatures bearing large eyes and larger mouths. Sworms are native to the Beanbean Kingdom and are abundant throughout the Beanish realm, but are especially abundant in the Beanbean Fields near the Beanish capital. Like traditional worms, Sworms traditionally live underground and primarily consume dirt. The elusive, subterranean nature of the Sworm means information on any possible civilization is scarce, if it exists at all. It is known, however, that Sworms are fully sapient and capable of speech.

This is a Tanooki, a subspecies of an Oriental, canid animal called the "raccoon dog". Raccoon dogs are closely related to foxes and exhibit many behaviors akin to them and are not, in fact, related to actual raccoons. Unlike their primitive "earth" counterparts, real raccoon dogs possess extraordinary powers and beauty. Raccoon dogs are the primary producers of Tanooki Suits, which give their wearer the ability of flight and temporary transformation into an invincible statue. Although the connection between raccoon dogs and Tanooki suits are undisputed, the debate on whether or not Super Leaf power-ups give Tanooki tails or actual raccoon tails to their wearer is a subject of fierce debate.

This is a Tanoomba. Tanoombas are a powerful varient of Goomba capable of flight and mimicry, taking the form and abilities of other creatures. Their mimicry is not perfect, however, as they will always retain either the leaf-like growth on their faces or their raccoon dog features. Tanoombas function, in essence, as Goombas permanently empowered by a Tanooki Suit and bare raccoon dog, not actual raccoon, tails. They behave far more like raccoon dogs than normal Goombas, attacking with their tails and powers instead of head bonking, stacking, or walking. Like raccoon dogs, Tanoombas love to climb and are inherently mischevious and sly. Like Goombas, they can be defeated by being stepped on.

This is a Tap Tap. Tap Taps are spiked, metal-like creatures boasting tremendous armor and defensive strength. They are inedible and cannot be swallowed by Yoshis. As such, they were once common guardsmen in Baby Bowser's holdings in the Yoshi Archipelago.

This extraterrestial alien is a member of Tatanga's species. Like Bowser Koopas, Tatanga is both the name of their greatest leader and the name of the species. Historically, it was the Tatangas that invaded Sarasaland. Mario completed a destruction of the entire species that was and is so thorough that Tatangas are believed to be extinct..... but are they really?

Tee-hee Butterflies are insect creature capable of flight and lacking any limbs, with the remarkably ability to alter their bodily composition on the fly. Native to the Yoshi Island archipelago, a Tee-hee Butterfly will constantly shift its colors from blue to pink every thirty seconds or so. When a Tee-hee Butterfly is blue, it secretes poison and becomes inedible and bitter. When a Tee-hee Butterfly is pink, it immediately detoxifies and becomes delicious. Pink Tee-hee Butterflies are a delicacy across the Mushroom World. Tee-hee Butterflies are considered delicacies because of the extreme difficulty it is to harvest one at the right color. If a Tee-hee Butterfly is shot, jumped on, or struck, it will turn blue in defense and remain that way in death. However, for example, if a Tee-hee Butterfly is consumed alive or left to die a natural death, it will remain in the state it was when its life functions ceased. As such, Yoshis are contracted to consume pink Tee-hee Butterflies and then sell the eggs they were processed into in order to enjoy the spectacular flavors locked within. However, the rarest and most sought-after delicacy from this creature is the direct consumption of a cooked, pink Tee-hee Butterfly.
This is a Tiki-Tak. Tiki-taks, also simply caled Tikis, are levitating, ethereal creatures of pure energy. They are not ghosts, nor are they dead, and can be killed and interacted with temporally.

This is a Toad. Toads are fungal humanoids distinguished by the bulbous fruiting body growing from their head and their generally pacifistic, charasmatic, docile behavior. Like all fungal-based creatures, Toads do not bleed, but rather, possess a solid life force in cells' chitin called Vim. Toads Like all fungal creatures, Toads are capable of fluid locamotion and movement. Toads are one of the most abundant species in the Mushroom World, with numbers similar to Goombas and Koopa Troopas. Almost all Toads dress in the same general outfit, differing colors. Some Toads are capable of sprouting hair from their fruiting bodies and not every Toad is cowardly. The fearsome Treasure Trackers, who plunder, rob, and kill wherever their greed takes them, all consist entirely of uncharacteristically ambitious, vicious Toads. A Toad was also the savior of the Peaceful Woods when Wario attempted his annexation of the region.

This is a Toady. Toadies are flighted, cloaked Koopas that perform elite and honor guard functions for Bowser. Historically, Toadies answer primarily to Kammy and Kamek and were tasked with the capture of the escaped Baby Mario and the other Star Children during Bowser's infancy. Toadies are deeply mystical and spiritualistic, performing most religious and clergy functions in both Bowser's cult of personality and traditional Koopa Paganism alongside Magikoopas. Where Magikoopas use brooms and occult forces to fly, Toadies use creaky, antiquated propellor propulsion- unchanged for generations -to keep them aloft, making their attacks and abductions highly conspicuous. Unlike Magikoopas, which are Koopa Troopas with special training in sorcery, Toadies are classified as a distinct species for the purposes of the game, which can fully breed with normal Koopas.

This is a Torpedo Ted, a name which is shared for both males and females of this species of sapient projectiles. Essentially, a Torpedo Ted is a Bullet Bill reengineered for self-guided propulsion underwater. Where Bullet Bills are shot on land and Missile Bills can maintain full speed while turning or for long periods of time, Torpedo Teds are launched in the water and use their built-in propulsion mechanisms to swim indefinitely, unless and until they either choose to detonate or they get lodged into something they cannot escape.

This is an Ukiki, sometimes simply deemed to be a "monkey". Ukikis are a type of monkey that are closely related in both genetics and intelligence to the Kong apes and Kong monkeys, although they cannot breed with one-another. Ukikis are found across the Mushroom World in sparse amounts, but they are most abundant on the Yoshi Island archipelago and other tropical areas. The "home base" of Ukiki civilization, the infrastructure and scope of which is buried in the darkest jungles, is the aptly named "Monkey World" in said archipelago.

This creature is the spirit of a deceased Kremling. Undead Kremlings come in three main forms. 
 Ghost Kremlings are extremely weak, temporal wraiths that are simply translucent Kremling spirits wearing a white sheet. They have little control over their ghost powers and cannot maintain an incorporal form, allowing them to be effortlessy defeated in the same way as a living Kremling. 
 Like most reptiles in the Mushroom World, Kremlings also have an undead, skeletal version of their species, a "Dry Kremling". However, a Dry Kremling is called a Kackle. 
 Last in this list are the Kloaks, which are fully transparent Kremling ghosts who can only be seen because their eyes and the clothes on their backs cannot turn invisible.

This is an Urchin. Urchins are slow moving, spiked, pufferfish-like fish found in the oceans of the Mushroom World. They have no connection to actual sea urchins in any way. Urchins are poisonous to the touch and can breathe on land for extended periods of time.

A Vampire is a type of corpse that becomes reanimated and leaves its lair (or grave) at night to feed on the blood of the living. Vampires require either blood, tomato and vegetable juices, red coloring, or similar proteins to blood to sustain themselves and will constantly seek these out. "Vegetarian" vampires that refuse blood and go for coloring or juice are monumentally weaker, possess far less power, and are vastly easier to kill than bloodthirsty vampires. However, all vampires are nonetheless extremely powerful and difficult to kill, attacking with remarkable grace and subtlety that leave creatures dead before they know they are attacked. Vampires are biologically immortal, but can be killed by sunlight, stakes, Starmen, and other star-based or light-based abilities and powers. They are severely allergic to garlic and cannot withstand water that was previously used in either a religious ceremony or offered to (and accepted by) the Star Spirits or other deified creatures. A vampire cannot enter a building it does not own or hold a legal stake in unless it is first invited inside. Vampires cannot make new vampires unless a living creature grants its consent to be "turned". To kill a vampire, one must either expose it to sunlight or drive a wooden stake through its heart. (If the creature's species did not have a heart in life, a stake through the head works instead.) Known as the "gentleman's monster", vampires are customarily bound by an ancient series of impeccable manners and boast a proud heritage that make them seem arrogant, snobbish, and pompous to their monster and undead peers. A distinct beauty and grace has always been associated with and displayed vampires in the Mushroom World, and indeed, "vampire" also refers to a beautiful female- particularly a vampiric female -that deceives and then "feeds" on the creature it has seduced or tricked. A vampire is bound by honor and goodwill to its friends, and the fiercest enemy of its foes.

This is an entity comprised of magically infused, living water. Water-based lifeforms must constantly remain attached to, or be replenished by, bodies of water in order to remain alive. The most common, and fearsome, example of a water-based lifeform are the gargantuan, multi-story Nep-Enuts of the Yoshi's Island archipelago, which, though having fangs, eyebrows, and a tongue, are nonetheless comprised solely of water and magic.

Winkle Snails are gastropodal mollusks found only in the Chucklehuck Woods. Along with Bubblanian Snails, Winkles are the only "true" snails among all the gastropodal mollusks of the Mushroom World. Winkles can breed with Bubblanian Snails, but not with slugs and Unshaven Sluggies. Winkles are ruthless and greedy, and will often capture wayward travelers, mug them, and force them to earn their money back through bloodsport in their Colleseum.

Whittles are docile, tree-based, plantlike lifeforms bearing a hard exoskeleton of solid wood. Although the largest population of Whittles is extraterrestrial, Whittles are not aliens and were once native to the Mushroom World.

This is an X-Naut. X-Nauts comprise a horde of vicious humanoids bent on conquest and destruction of Rogueport and its surrounding regions and, ultimately, all the galaxies of the Mushroom Universe, by enslaving the Shadow Queen and using her powers to subdue all life. Skilled in technology and desensitized to pain and hatred, they will destroy anyone and anything in order to accomplish the goals of their master, Grodus.

This is a Yarikuri Obake, the spirit of a deceased Goom. Like Boo Buddies, Yarikuri Obakes will hide their face and freeze in place when they view the living. As with any hostile Goom, the spirits of Gooms past also wield spears and make for expert spearmen.

This is a Yoshi. Yoshis are among the most common dinosaurs in the Mushroom World, originating from the Yoshi Island archipelago and spreading to the rest of the Mushroom World. Highly adaptable and ravenous, they will eat anything and everything they can latch onto their tongues. Most Yoshis are among the greatest and most loyal servants in the Mushroom World and, when alone, form tribal clans with simple familial ties and community-based hatchling rearing. All Yoshis are paternal and nurturing to any infant or juvenile creature- except Bowser Koopas -and are responsible for saving Mario and Luigi's lives. Without Yoshis, there would be no Mario Brothers. Yoshis are deeply connected with the natural world and most Yoshis worship the Super Happy Tree, located in the heart of the main Yoshi Island, in their numerous sacred groves. However, evil or nefarious Yoshis do exist. DO NOT trust a wicked Yoshi with collecting or paying tribute or taxation to their liege or country.

This is a Yurarin, a flighted, air-breathing, dragon-like creature that almost perfectly resembles a seahorse. They are the mounts of flying Piyonpi cavalrymen. The most powerful leaders among them are called Yurarin Boos (baring no resemblance or connection to the spirit baring the same name) and can shoot fire.

This is a Yux. Yuxen are lifeforms created entirely from scratch, using artificial means, to serve as sentries and powerful guardians for the X-Naut horde. Capable of flight and spectacular feats of psychic power, Yuxen are literally biological weapons made to serve martial purposes. After the X-Nauts fell and their purpose was removed, the Yuxen set out on their own to try and be accepted by the rest of the Mushroom World. A Yux protects itself by spawning a triangular Mini-Yux, four of which render the Yux totally invincible to every known attack to ever exist, even the forces of the Star Rod and the Peach Beam! Three types of Yuxen exist: the normal, green Yux, the elite, grey Z-Yuxen that protect extraterrestrial and space operations, and the mighty X-Yux, a red Yux capable of easily taking on Bowser or even Mario himself. Preferring to be called a "Cross Yux", the X-Yuxen are the undisputed leaders of all known Yuxen. Yuxen are extremely intelligent and remarkably friendly, but they will obey any order from their superior officers unless their officers are deposed or they themselves die.

This is a Zenisuki, a poweful, purse-clutching wraith with greed and a lust for money exceeding all but Wario, Waluigi, and the Greed Spirit itself. Zenisukis are fully incorporal and can only be hurt by other ghosts. Traditionally, they directly command the Yurikuri Obakes (ghost Ghooms) and are among the highest ranking members of the Syrup Gang pirates that plague the Kitchen Isles.

Zingers are massive wasps native to the Kongobongo Jungles and the Kremisphere. Almost universally mistaken for bees, Zingers are enraged by this misnomer, adding to the infinite, boundless hatred they maintain for all life. Zingers call no creature master except themselves, hold no permanent allegiance to any nation or hive except themselves, and will never, ever stop blocking everything and everybody when they jump across expanses. Ever.

This is a Bonneter, part of the dominant species in the Cap Kingdom. They are ghostly apparitions, said by some to be the spirits of discarded dresswear, while others argue that it is a more dangerous form of Boo. Whatever the truth is, nobody can doubt the fact Bonneters are absolutely ravishing, and their fashion tends to spread quick to many races. Bonneters are capable of enslavement by possessing ("CAPturing", they call it) almost any other living being and exploiting them by any means they see fit.

The Burrboes, a distant cousin of the Goomba and Galoomba, claim to be the oldest species on the Odyssey Continents, and many theorize them to be a living relic of the oldest form of Goomba, being equated to Shellcreepers. Tending towards vicious temperament, they once held control of the great Thunder Kingdom centuries ago. Nowadays the largest populations of Burrboes live in squalor in the Cascade Kingdom. They wouldn't have it any other way.

Steam Gardeners are the peaceful, artificial inhabitants of the Steam Gardens and the surrounding forestlands. The Steam Gardeners are a highly logical people who live their lives humbly and quietly. Nobody knows who built them, or if the Steam Gardens even had previous inhabitants at all, but the Steam Gardeners could not care less about where they came from. They are too focused on the groundskeeping of their legendary gardens.

This is a Tostarenan. Tostarenans, despite resembling skeletons, are in fact alive and in possession of organs, such as a beating heart. They wear ponchos, gloves, and robes to obscure the organs visible underneath their bones. The Tostarenans introduced gambling to the Odyssey continent and hold claim to one of the most holy relics in the Lunatheologist Faith, the Binding Band. Most remember them as a kind and casual people, but the harshness of the desert and depth of their faith can create the finest warrior-poets in the Odyssey Continents. Although not corrupt or criminal themselves, their deep connection to gambling and dominance of casinoes on the Odyssey Continents mean they get along well with pirates, crooks, and the seedy underbelly of the Mushroom World.

Chinchoes are undead Tostarenans, said to come back to life at night to partake in their traditions and whatever is left of their old lives. While Chinchoes are kind to Sand Kingdom natives, outsiders are never welcomed into their domain. Don't let the sun go down on your foreign rear in the Sand Kingdom.

The Lochladies of the Lake Kingdom are known by their innocent beauty. It is said nobody can look upon a Lochlady without feeling at peace with oneself. They are legendary among the Lunatheologists due to their production of important religious regalia: reproductions of the legendary Lochlady Dress. It's said no Lunatheologist bride can be married proudly without one.

The ancient Jaxies, built out of living stone, are the noble, sapient mounts of the Sand Kingdom, being comparable to the Yoshis of other lands. The Jaxi are synonymous with the Sand Kingdom, and they are the ships of the desert sands, giving safe passage for a reasonable fee.

This is a Moe-Eye. Supposedly the original inhabitants of what is now the Sand Kingdom, the Moe-Eyes are as mysterious as they are beloved as a symbol of the land. Moe-eyes tend to stick to secluded areas, sometimes alone, sometimes in small family units, fleeing if their privacy is encroached upon by curious outsiders.

The snail-like inhabitants of the Seaside Kingdom, the Bubblainians are docile pacifists. Populations of Bubblainians commonly lounge in the sun by their land's famous carbonated seas, and are willing to share their sun, sand, and sea with any outsider. Alongside the Winkles, Bubblanians are the only known "true" snails among the gastropodal mollusks of the Mushroom World. Bubblanians can breed with Winkles, but not with slugs and Unshaven Suggies.

The eternal enemy of the Bubblainian people, the Gushens contrast their more peaceful foe in near every way. Long have the Gushens warred over the homelands of the legendary Sparkle Water, and every time their rivals have found it in them to beat them back with the help of their fellow Lunatheologists. One day, perhaps, the Gushen will have their way...

Uproots are a secretive, malicious species that are the chaos to the Steam Gardeners' order. Uproots can often be found causing trouble for the Wooded Kingdom, simply because some creatures want to watch the world burn. In this hatred and spite, they reak havoc merely for the fun of it.

The Shiverians of the Snow Kingdom are a humble species trying to make their way in a harsh environment and succeeding with flying colors. Shiverians are known for their physical might, their odd cultural customs, and their grand cuisine, which is second only to the Luncheon Kingdom.

There once was a great state known as the Thunder Empire, whose architecture was built to last a thousand years. Today, that architecture is all that remains of the realm, brought low in their attempts to harness the power of what they thought was a god. This "god" was the Great Thunder Dragon, who slaughtered the prideful people of the Thunder Empire and took their palace as its new nesting ground. Today, the descendants of that false god rule the Ruined Kingdom with iron claws.

The proud Volbonans who hail from the Luncheon Kingdom. These odd entities resemble giant forks, and are considered to command as much confusion from outsiders as respect. Luncheon culture is steeped in history, particularly its rich culinary tradition, and it is said they were the first civilization to arise from tribalism on the Odyssey Continents.

Lagomorpha is the collective, taxonomic term for rabbits and hares. Rabbits comprise any varient of swift, burrowing mammals characterized by soft fur, long ears, a stubby tail, and the bearing of bald, blind young. They are born blind and are raised by their mothers. Hares comprise any varient of larger swift, surface nesting mammals bearing otherwise identical features to rabbits. Hares are able to defend themselves at birth and reach maturity far faster. The Mushroom World boasts rabbits and hares throughout its landscape, all of which are sapient. These range from small, swift rabbits to the more anthromorphic, Broodal hares. Broodals, by far the most powerful Lagomorph civilization and class, can grow to over twenty feet in size and weigh several tons. Rabbits and hares are spectacularly durable: there have been confirmed sightings of rabbits and hares on the planet's moon!

column1: #### Moon Rabbits, will not be implemented ####

column2: The tricksy extraterrestrial mammals known as Moon Rabbits are a mysterious people, that's a fact nobody can deny. There are many theories to what Moon Rabbits truly are, and what they want, but the Stars know that they will never tell, and their motives as a culture will always remain a mystery to foolish outsiders. What is known about them is that they have some connection to the Stars, and seem to have originated on the Moon. Some claim them to be Lumas taking a more agile form temporarily, while others claim that they are servants of the Stars that give gifts to those they deem worthy, while yet more claim they are just that, simple rabbits who happen to live on the moon.
